reviews.author: Max Simon
reviews.text: My wife, daughter and myself had dinner here Saturday 12/21/19. We went here because of the high ratings the establishment had. Our experience was not so memorable.  We had made reservations but they were not needed as the restaurant was not busy. There were at least 6-8 employees in the establishment this evening and there were three tables occupied by guests. We were seated and given menus but our table was not acknowledged by any server for at least five minutes. There was only one server even though there were plenty of other staff working but they were not waiting tables for some reason? Our server finally took our order. I had a ceasar salad that came to the table warm. The romaine lettuce was actually "warn". I have never had a warm salad that should always be served cold. It was just the start of what was to come. The server did not know the size of the shrimp nor did the chef and they order the shrimp from there febdo. Another red flag. Our mozzarella sticks were cold, the entrees were served cold and not tasty at all. Overall, this was the worst dining experience we have ever had.  Do NOT fine here. They have no clue what they are doing.

reviews.author: Steven Smiddy
reviews.text: Ordered delivery to hotel as I am in town traveling for work. Deliver was prompt, however, the food was substandard.  The caramelized streak sandwich had three thin slices, and with a white sauce, and a few mushrooms, the salad had four croutons and lettuce, limp and dull. The mushroom and prawns were six tiny shrimp, and was tasteless and one still had it's tail with watery white sauce....apparently the watery white sauce is the stable of this order. Attempted to contact facility regarding the quality of the order and found them to be unhelpful. Extremely disappointed especially for the prices, and while there in-facility reviews appear outstanding, I am left to wonder if this is the service travelers endure for hotel delivery because we are just visiting the area and frequently not heard from again. However, bad food is bad food, and this is no exception. Reconsider delivery orders from this facility, as I will not make that mistake again.

reviews.author: Juanita Pia
reviews.text: on September 27th, 2019 we had our rehearsal dinner at your restaurant. I’d been in contact with your general manager & catering/ event coordinator Alexandrea via e-mail and on September 10th, 2019 via email I inquired to see if the private space was available and she informed me it was via email on September 14th, 2019 then we emailed once after that regarding menu options.   On the 27th up on our arrival my guest informed me that they were seated in the back of the restaurant and I asked to speak to someone in charge Alexandrea informed  me there was another party upstairs that had more guests. She was very rude in my opinion and out of line in the way she spoke to me. I informed her of our communications and she denied having knowledge (I have attached the part of our conversation where she did indeed confirm the space on September 14th).   On top of that the service was awful and slow. Also, due to the slow/ bad service my guest were not offered desserts and when I requested them to go it seem as if I was asking for something I’d hadn’t already paid for. If I’m paying for something I expect to get it and that’s not what happened. Several orders came out wrong to the point people were so tired of waiting they accepted whatever was put in front of them to avoid a longer wait. My husband (the groom) waited over 40min to be served actually his food was completely forgotten. A persons salad was taken before they finished as well and waters were not refilled.  It was hard to communicate and be social due the noise and tight space. Which is why I reserved a PRIVATE SPACE. I had my family from out of town here and the dinner was subsequently the only time I’d be able to enjoy a meal with them while they were here. My husband had to sit away from me due to the lack of space and seating

reviews.author: Liz Alley
reviews.text: The food is delicious and the staff goes above and beyond to make your meal perfect. We were a group of 50 for a rehearsal dinner and we had guests with dietary restrictions which they were more than happy to accommodate.  If you are ever in Troutdale, highly recommend .

reviews.text: Great food inside a great atmosphere. The food was good portion besides tasting fantastic & the staff was quick to helpful every moment! The restaurant itself has a simple & cozy charm. Teamed up w/ the great staff & tasty food, you can't help but want to return again!

reviews.author: Shark Man
reviews.text: I’ve been to several fantastic Italian restaurants, as much as I was hoping to find another sadly its not. The decor is tired, chairs and tables are from a closed buffet place, picnic type table cloth, there was nothing welcoming as other places I’ve dined at. Nothing was really close to top notch, the drinks were mediocre at best and not worth a second round. As for the food...lackluster, zero Pop or pizazz, over done and under seasoned, the price did not equal the meal quality. I’m not one for tough reviews, I prefer a positive, favorable experience and review, I truly hope the owner, management takes the time to train kitchen staff on true Italian food preparation, also review your drinks and bartending skills.

reviews.author: Brian Smith
reviews.text: I really wanted to like this place. Yhe food qas good portioned,  but lacked spice and flavor. The paint and decor is old and dated and thier "bar" was lack luster and slap-shod. Looks like a banquet or reception hall, not a nice place to have a good dinning experience.

reviews.author: Will Wiley
reviews.text: Roasted garlic chicken, penne basil pesto chicken, and Caesar salads were all so blandly seasoned that we both were compelled to salt everything heavily (for perspective, we never salt our plated food, & try to minimize our intake). My cream sauce had no richness to it; Even the roasted garlic lacked roasted garlic flavor- I'm not sure how that happens- it was under roasted, though. The pesto was pretty good after the salting.  Someone needs to taste test the dishes & adjust the recipes where needed. While pleasant, our server needed prompting even after 10 minutes waiting for drink refills, while the place was not very busy. I hope that they adjust, I'd like to see them succeed.

reviews.author: Megan Funk
reviews.text: Very good! It might look a little dated, but the food is excellent. After a bad experience at Olive Garden, we were looking for a new Italian place to try and someone recommended this. I'm glad they did because we just found out new favorite! Much better than OG, and half the price.

reviews.text: Food was good and unique. The restaurant outdated and defiantly needs some remodeling, it’s not Italian nor American but rather cheap layout especially upstairs.  Good place, good food, but needs an update

reviews.author: Tony Vargas
reviews.text: The best portabello mushroom appetizer around...and the eggplant is amazing!

reviews.author: Robert Stamper
reviews.text: Awesome atmosphere, awesome service, reasonable pricing. It's the new go to restaurant for Italian food.

reviews.author: Janna Stamper
reviews.text: Great food!

reviews.author: Jeannie Scovel
reviews.text: Awesome food and good prices. I will go back.

reviews.author: Megan Gibbard
reviews.text: Really good food and drinks for a great price!

reviews.author: Gary Yeend
reviews.text: We love this place. After finding ourselves there a few weeks in a row we now call it Same Time Next Week. ( A tribute to a movie favorite, Same time next year) food is good & portions & prices are appealing.

reviews.author: Ashley Kimbel
reviews.text: The appetizer/bruschetta/2 pasta entree/shared dessert/soup or salad special for 28 dollars is amazing!! So much food you will be leaving with left overs. I know this sounds cheezy (no pun intended) but the Mac and Cheese (cajun style) is a must. I like to think im a Mac&Cheese  connoisseur and its always bland, always, but this was truly robustly cheesy. Its exactly what you think, heavy creamy delicious italian food that promptly puts you into a food coma. Staff was great, food came out fast and hot and there were many regulars who were fun to chat with. Definitely give them a shot!

reviews.author: Pam Krein
reviews.text: Great place to eat.

reviews.author: luis velasquez
reviews.text: I give 3 stars because  the restrooms were very dirty,  the food and service are very good

reviews.author: Barry Schaeffer
reviews.text: Great seafood risotto

reviews.author: Denise Marez-Valencia
reviews.text: Food is delicious! Great service! Excellent restaurant!

reviews.author: bob lewis44
reviews.text: Deserts are fantastic!

reviews.author: Paul De Kay
reviews.text: Don't be in a rush. They allow time to enjoy each course of your meal.  Outstanding entre selection variety to sat

reviews.author: Bob Keller
reviews.text: Waiter service was excellent.  Portions were very large.  Rich sauces and food; pastas were nice.  "Tiger prawns" were shrimp.

reviews.author: Phillip Carleton
reviews.text: The cream sauce dishes were good, but entirely too much sauce for the amount of pasta.

reviews.text: The service was slow. The bars were at the beginning and end of the course so you didn't have drinks in between holes. Service in the restaurant was slow and they weren't  attentive to what you requested. It was my first time to a McMenamins and I'm not in a hurry to go to another one soon. I was not impressed.

reviews.author: juicemomma47
reviews.text: We have eaten here many times and the service is always great. My husband loves spaghetti and meatballs, I have had many different dishes and they have always been delicious.

reviews.author: Matt Anderson

reviews.author: linda spencer
reviews.text: It's pretty good.pasta could have been drained better, but meal was good. I would go back!

reviews.author: Ted Ewoldt
reviews.text: The food 'tastes authentic'. The desserts are very good. My parents love this place a bunch and go for their great deals on a regular basis. They sometimes have gift cards on sale and if you buy a few, you can have very reasonably priced dinners with your family.

reviews.author: Kym Thomas
reviews.text: Good service and nice food. I had salmon sandwich and it was delicious.

reviews.author: Cheryl Baker
reviews.text: Good food, good service. Everyone is friendly and helpful

reviews.author: Amanda Birney
reviews.text: My family had a great time here for lunch. I tried the Ravioli al Forno and the Ravioli Portabello from the vegetarian menu and of the two I would say the Ravioli al Forno was my favorite. I also had a taste of the Cream of Zucchini soup and loved the flavor. I would definitely recommend trying this restaurant!

reviews.author: Heather Ricks
reviews.text: This place has great food, and they are always super friendly.

reviews.author: Michele King
reviews.text: Enjoyed my dinner very much.  Service is really great.

reviews.author: Don King
reviews.text: Great service and delicious food.

reviews.author: Nikki Steiber
reviews.text: The kiddo portion was good size and yummy.  The staff was great.  I cant believe the cooks in the tiny kitchen produce the  deliciousness they did!!!   A nice treat after a long day!!!

reviews.author: JP Blount
reviews.text: Staying the night at Edgefield but wanted some good Italian.  Checked the positive reviews and this place looked good.  Well the reviews were Right.  Very comfortable, family establishment with simple decor.  We were warmly greeted even though no reservation.  Got a great table in back.  Complimentary brusheta was very good.  Ordered a bottle of their house Cabernet Sauvignon with dinner.  My wife ordered the stuffed halibut with risotto and steamed carrots & broccoli.  It came with soup or salad.  She got the Caesar salad.  I ordered the chicken in pesto cream sauce with butternut squash and zucchini with a Greek salad.  Both dishes and wine were excellent.  The service was good and she made several good recommendations.  If you're in Troutdale and love Italian, STOP HERE 😉

reviews.author: Russell Brown
reviews.text: Authentic Italian, not commercialized. Fantastic canalloni

reviews.author: Jamie Wohletz
reviews.text: Wonderful atmosphere, warm and friendly staff, and nice views from the second floor window seats!

reviews.author: Rebecca Anzueto
reviews.text: Very busy restaurant just by the train tracks.  Food was delicious, prices are VERY reasonable. Kids menus were on books (plus on my side). Cocktails were a little strong. Would definitely come back if I lived in the area. I had the salmon pasta with zucchini and capers - delicious. Basil artichoke dip was soooo good.

reviews.author: Francie Shelton
reviews.text: I loved this place!  So delicious!  Reminds me of my Italian Grandma.  Can’t wait to go back.

reviews.author: Jeffrey Robertson
reviews.text: The sever gave great suggestions and overall pleasant service for the evening. The food was amazing and just worth the price!

reviews.author: Randall Unruh
reviews.text: My faorite place to stop for dinner on the way back after visiting the Columbia Gorge.

reviews.author: Georgene Jones
reviews.text: We had dinner here tonight and we really enjoyed it.  Service was outstanding and the food was excellent.

reviews.author: Drew McGovern
reviews.text: Service was great, and the atmosphere was nice. The mozzarella sticks were really well done, stringy and pretty good sized. I was shocked by the chicken parmesan sandwich. The bell peppers were raw, there was essentially no cheese, and the sandwich came on a Walmart hamburger bun so drowned in marinara that it fell apart halfway through.

reviews.author: Oliver Kelso
reviews.text: Prices are good, but the food was sort of so-so. We were there with a large party of about 15 people, and the wait staff got pretty disorganized, not knowing who had ordered what. It tasted about as Italian as Olive Garden though imo.

reviews.author: Julie Van Hee
reviews.text: Great staff, terrible food. We ordered the minestrone soup, it was ice cold. They brought new soup, barely warm. I ordered lasagna and it tasted only of cheese. I couldn’t taste any sauce. Very disappointed, like to give local businesses a chance. Not again.

reviews.author: Jean Mckitrick
reviews.text: Love this restaurant!

reviews.author: Will Gray jr
reviews.text: Good

reviews.author: Mark Stegemeyer
reviews.text: This, my friends, is a gem. The food was exceptional, the service timely and the ambiance... neighborly. I rarely review 5 stars, but we were so impressed we bought a few gift cards to share with friends. Solo artist on the weekend, but upstairs was more intimate and has a view.

reviews.author: Mindi Green
reviews.text: The food was alright.  The restaurant was dirty,  not cared for well.  The carpets were very dirty.

reviews.author: Herbert Ruttkies
reviews.text: (Translated by Google) Dirty tablecloths are turned and used again. The glasses were full of streaks and fingerprints. The seat was very dark.  (Original) Schmutzige Tischdecken werden gewendet und nochmal benutzt. Die Wassergläser waren voller Schlieren und Fingerabdrücke.  Der Sitzplatz war sehr dunkel.

reviews.author: Kevin Kays
reviews.text: Great place to eat. Will go again.

reviews.author: Kyle Burns
reviews.text: Amazing food for decent prices. Its a must

reviews.author: G C
reviews.text: Excellent food, excellent service, some GF choices.

reviews.author: Brian Jole
reviews.text: Was pretty busy as to be expected on a Friday evening. Anyhow I've sat downstairs before and upstairs tonite. Two of the upper rooms are small and could be too close for comfort for some people. For spouse and I we sat in a little room by ourselves which was quite a nice experience. The owner or chef or ? (I'm not sure who) personally showed us various art throughout the restaurant, a very nice display. The food was very good, we went for traditional Italian fare spaghetti meatballs and Bolognese over penne. Nice waitress we had whom I sure does 5000 steps a nite up and down the stairs. I will come back for sure! But perhaps midweek when it's a little more chill.

reviews.author: Mary Howell
reviews.text: Take out food seems better than staying in.  Very noisy, but quaint atmosphere.

reviews.author: Nick Liezen
reviews.text: I love this place! Great food, family owned. Big enough that despite having a bunch of regulars, they always have space for more. Can't recommend them enough.

reviews.author: Christina McKenna
reviews.text: If you haven't found this gem in Troutdale, you're missing out. From the time you order, to when you leave, it's very classy. The food is hot all the way through, cooked perfect. Service is 100% fantastic.

reviews.author: matt cropper
reviews.text: Amazing food and atmosphere.  The service was beyond great

reviews.author: Robin Binkley
reviews.text: Delicious food and great service. The prices were lower than expected. Very fast and fresh. If I'm ever back in the area, I'd definitely eat here again.

reviews.author: Larry Elfring
reviews.text: Best lasagna ever! Never go 2 olive garden again

reviews.author: Sherry Morisch
reviews.text: Loved It! What a great time. My fiance and I are coming back for dinner sometime. ;) Thanks for the great Mother's day event.

reviews.author: Just some cowboy with internet access

reviews.author: Justin Antonietti
reviews.text: Hands down,  best italian food weve ever eaten!

reviews.author: Deborah Wilson
reviews.text: Had lunch.. great service, awesome choices and reasonable prices...food was great

reviews.author: Lainey Ressler
reviews.text: One of the best dinners we've ever had from service and speed to taste of food and price. Their 2 dinners for $28 includes an app, a soup or salad each, two pasta entrees, and a dessert to share - the chocolate cake has layers of chocolate mousse that are to die for. The two pasta dinners we tried were both stellar and the tomato basil oil they bring with the bread was the best I've ever had. If you like Italian, you should visit!

reviews.author: Jason Dugan
reviews.text: This was our second time in.  This is a nice little Italian restaurant in Troutdale. My main dish,  Tuscan Garlic Chicken, was tasty. I'm a BIG fan of garlic so I could have gone for a bit more garlic but I get it.  I think they could step it up when it comes to their salads. Their portions where spot on and everything was very hot when it arrived at the table.  The staff was very friendly and attentive.

reviews.author: B DeWeese
reviews.text: Best Italian restaurant around. Great deals great service. Always great people. 28 dollars gets you dinner for two. An appetizer, two entrees, two salads and one dessert.

reviews.author: mike e
reviews.text: Great food

reviews.author: Rick Dwyer
reviews.text: Great service and good food. It was a little noisy when we were there but could have been due to a large group seated near us.

reviews.author: Peggy Andrews
reviews.text: Great Gluten Free menu.

reviews.author: Joe Lourenḉo

reviews.author: Lavish Lava60
reviews.text: Not satisfied at all, the place had a weird atmosphere and our first waiter was odd. My boyfriend asked for a drink and he never came back second waitress who helped was nice though, Our food wasn't the best either my shrimp scampi was watery and my boyfriends chicken parm was passable until he felt it crunch.

reviews.author: Nancy Parmenter
reviews.text: Great food!!

reviews.author: Matthew Smith
reviews.text: Very good food. Service is great. The specials are fantastic. Oh....the "piece" of cake is about a Quarter of a entire cake. Absolutely huge

reviews.author: Everest Wolf
reviews.text: Great food

reviews.author: Jeff Holliday
reviews.text: Everything on the menu is amazing. Very kid friendly. Extremely friendly wait staff. Reasonably priced.

reviews.author: Jamie H. Panda Girl
reviews.text: This was our first time coming to this restaurant.  I've added the menu to the pictures. But I also added our food pictures too. So please click on the pictures.  The bread and dip is delicious.  The salad barely had any salad dressing on it.  So they gave me a small bowl of dressing.  The Male server brought our appetizers me and my husband each got shrimp and mushroom and the Male server hesitated and switched plates he decided to hand my husbands plate to me and gave my plate to my husband like he was confused who was supposed to get what but what he was doing was one plate had 5 shrimp and the other plate had 9 shrimp lol lol so the server gave me the 9 shrimp instead of my husband which I thought was kinda funny. But honestly the kitchen should be making sure the plate has an even amount of shrimp going out on plates especially when there going to the same tables. It was very obvious. Also the dish said mushrooms and my husband had 1/4 of a mushroom on his plate.  I had the Lobster Ravioli to me it didn't taste like lobster but it did taste like seafood and it did taste good.  My husband had Chicken Parmesan he said it was good but he wouldn't say it was great.  The reason why we're scoring the restaurant a 3 is because of how extremely loud the is.  They have the dishes outside the kitchen area and the guy who does it is so loud that he doesn't care how much noise he is making. They also put the used dishes in the bucket at the entrance just inside the kitchen and that makes a lot of loud noises as it's open with no blockers to the dining area.  It was so loud in there we couldn't hear our waitress.  People were talking loud.  We thought Mo's was loud. This place is much louder.  In the future we will get food to go if we decide we want to try other food.  The parking is parell parking and you can not park in the back.  If you can handle really loud places then give this place a try.  If this info is helpful and you like the pics please click Like Thank you 😊

reviews.author: Matthew Smith
reviews.text: Went on a whim for something else right before work. It was delicious. I had the daily special of lobster and shrimp over linguine which was excellent.  Had the mussels for appetizer which was run of the mill. Had a HUGE piece of cake for dessert (literally it's a 1/4 of the entire cake) it was good although a little dry for my taste. Will definitely make it back soon maybe for a lunch special.

reviews.author: Robert schneider
reviews.text: Very nice staff food was well prepared 5/5 would go again.

reviews.author: Scarlett Koch
reviews.text: Amazing happy hour!

reviews.author: ndreaj
reviews.text: Great gluten free slecetion and they've never contaminated me.

reviews.author: Julia Montoya
reviews.text: I was here for a baby shower so I can't really review the Italian food that they make there. Also the baby shower started at 10am so they were serving us breakfast anyway. The food was pretty good, just regular breakfast food and all of it was made really well and it tasted delicious. I would really like to come back here for lunch or dinner sometime.

reviews.author: Collins Kids
reviews.text: Awesome food, amazing prices, low wait times, food was there within like five minutes of when I ordered!

reviews.author: Lili Harewood
reviews.text: Great ambiance and food!

reviews.author: seahawks337
reviews.text: The dinner happy hour is a terrific deal. $15 for an appetizer, two soups/salads, and a pasta entree to share. The two entrees I have tried were quite tasty. Gotta love free 'bruschetta' immediately when you sit as well!

reviews.author: IVAN MUÑOZ

reviews.text: Great food good drinks... The deserts were excellent. The Tuscan garlic chicken was great. My wife had stuffed halibut she said was amazing.

reviews.text: No hyperbole. This is the best Italian food I have ever eaten this side of Chicago. Perfect seasoning, reasonably priced, and you don't have to wait long to get your food. It is more than just delicious. It is a dining experience.

reviews.author: Justin Jones
reviews.text: Waited several minutes just to be greeted while the hostess was having an arguement with some one over the phone. When finally seated, table cloth was filthy and covered with hair. Did not stick around for the food.

reviews.author: Michelle Wolff
reviews.text: The best Italian food around. Great service and good prices.

reviews.author: Owen Thornhill
reviews.text: Great value, nice size portions and good service. Appatiser, sour or salad, pas6a dish and dessert for two people for just $28. Nice looking restaurant also.

reviews.author: Caitlin Hunsaker
reviews.text: Fantastic food, great portions at reasonable prices. I have zero complaints. I will be coming here every time I pass through.

reviews.author: Connie Trough
reviews.text: We have been coming to Pompelos for 5 years. Always consistent with wonderful food, ambiance and customer service. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: kevin Cassady
reviews.text: Great eats, there's just something about homemade from family recipes that keeps us going back. Ymmmmmm

reviews.author: Angela Batterton
reviews.text: Fantastic service, outstanding food ,beautiful decor

reviews.author: Kathleen Gallagher
reviews.text: I have visted here on and off for years.  I can say the food is consistently delicious and fairly priced.  Tonight I had a great dinner, excellent customer service, and a house made chocolate cake that was superb.  I will be back very soon.

reviews.author: Leonidas Montenegro
reviews.text: Amazing food and excellent service.

reviews.author: David Strom
reviews.text: Awesome food at fantastic prices...

reviews.author: Romeo Russian
reviews.text: Had a date night here and the first impression of this place was amazing. It smelled delicious and looked cozy. The food on the other hand is drowned in sauce and it didn't taste authentic. Also maybe because we were seated next to the windows but there were some flies flying around.

reviews.author: Jim Greis
reviews.text: Food was good, veal saltimbaca and pork milanese are highly recommended, stuffed portobello was lacking in creativity and flavor. Expected more of an explanation as to "Happy Hour" and found drink prices to be high. Overall I would recommend if you're in the area and want above average Italian cuisine.

reviews.author: Allen Jackson
reviews.text: Excellent food.

reviews.author: Nathan Keith
reviews.text: Love these family restaurants! Very good service and was able to order a non menu item (spaghetti aglio  e olio con frutti de mar). Like the ambiance; table clothes, cloth napkins, heavy cutlery, and the wall murals from Pompeii. Food was very good Good Barbera wine

reviews.author: Shae Berghuis
reviews.text: This was authentic Italian food. I've been to Italy and this place reminded me of the food there. My husband and I loved it so much we also got more to take home after our meal. Even our 1.5 yr old son liked it.

reviews.author: glenn conley
reviews.text: Excellent service, amazing prices.  Very little parking, simple decor.  My dinner tasted different than I expected and I couldn't eat even a fraction of it -- nice sized portions! -- but definitely worth another trip to try more of their fabulous menu.

reviews.author: David Jones
reviews.text: Food and Service were great even in the middle part of the day.

reviews.author: Suzanne wolfe
reviews.text: Beautiful simple place in historical Troutdale. Delicious food!!!

reviews.author: Kate Martin
reviews.text: Love this place!  Anytime I'm close I'll stop in here. Foods great, people are warm and cheerful

reviews.author: Todd Hussey
reviews.text: Very nice menu and great food. Employees are very nice and service is pretty good.

reviews.author: Tammy Davenport
reviews.text: Good place to eat Italian food😊

reviews.author: Geoffrey Ogden
reviews.text: Excellent food, always very friendly.

reviews.author: Sweet Epie
reviews.text: Always a wonderful staff. Food is fantastic.  Is able to customize order (example someone in my party didn't eat broccoli and they were willing to remove that from the Gnocchi dish). I highly recommend this restaurant.  5 ☆ every time I have gone there.

reviews.author: Thomas Minor
reviews.text: Had a very nice meal Friday after Valentine's day. We ordered off the specials menu. Food arrived promptly and was delicious. Environment casual. Our waiter was friendly and courteous. Would definitely come back.

reviews.author: Robert Kolb
reviews.text: Great Italian food good place to go

reviews.author: Richard Lobinske
reviews.text: Delicious food and attentive service.

reviews.author: Suz Johnson
reviews.text: Nice local Italian dining. Expensive, but a nice change from local Gresham fare.

reviews.author: Gayle Valentine
reviews.text: Great

reviews.author: Anne Blake-Nickels
reviews.text: We just had breakfast. Super good food, friendly service and inexpensive too!

reviews.author: Alexander Plekan
reviews.text: Great atmosphere, friendly staff and the food is to die for!

reviews.author: Brittany Stevens
reviews.text: Love the food!! Love the cutie place!!! Best service ever!!!! Amazing price and deals!!!! Can't ask for anything better!!!

reviews.author: Mark Greenawalt
reviews.text: Great authentic Italian food. I had the gnocchi and prawns. My daughter ate fettuccini and loved it. Good kids menu, nice atmosphere.

reviews.author: Holly carlin
reviews.text: Great service and Food! The fries are amazing and the burger was delicious!

reviews.author: Grover Smith
reviews.text: Great place to eat. The service and food were great

reviews.author: Christopher Botcheos
reviews.text: Friendly and professional staff.  Food was wonderful with the veggies cooked to perfection

reviews.author: Amanda West
reviews.text: Great little restaurant. We stopped here with a party of 5 after the 4th of July parade. We were seated next to the window overlooking the train tracks. The kids Loved seeing the train go through towards the end of our meal.  My mother got the veil Saltimbuco and I got the chicken parmesan. My food was good, hers was Absolutely amazing. The kids got pasta and vegetables which they enjoyed but was typical kids food.  Our waitress was very friendly and very patient with the kids. She brought books for them and then brought them little baskets of toys.  We had a very pleasant experience and we all plan on eating here next year when we are back in town for the 4th of July.

reviews.author: David Johnson
reviews.text: Delicious food at a very good price

reviews.author: Jeff Vance
reviews.text: Nice small homestyle food

reviews.author: Jordan Swetnam
reviews.text: Server is always friendly here, despite how difficult my family can be. Food is great, and quite authentic, though the complimentary bruschetta is quite acidic and will cause bloating. Their marinara is tasty and seasoned well.. quite chunky. Prices are fair! Enjoy their special happy hour pricing for 2 or dinner pricing for two... $28 got us any pasta dish... side salad or soup, appetizer, and dessert... FOR TWO. The happy hour/lunch version is cheaper.

reviews.author: Joe Schultz
reviews.text: Great service, the wife had prime rib she said it was good. I had the tiger prawn fettuccine with lobster tail that was delicious. A nice atmosphere will try it again.

reviews.author: Rose Zehner
reviews.text: Just had an excellent New Year's Eve dinner there.

reviews.author: Brittnee Coffman
reviews.text: I ordered the pan-fried lamb and it was mushy and disgusting. The waitress said that the menu is misleading and the way she described  the lamb to be prepared is actually braised. She even went as far to try and tell me that pan-fried is not with oil.. umm yes it is, at least that’s how I was taught my by culinary teacher. The part that really irritates me is that they do nothing to correct the problem other than offer you more of their disappointing food. Not only was my meal gross, but the hazelnut crusted halibut and Tuscan chicken. I would not recommend because of the food and lack of customer satisfaction. If I could give less than 1 star, I would.

reviews.author: Loretta Winchester
reviews.text: Service was great!!

reviews.author: Ron Stacy
reviews.text: Food and service was superb. Reasonable prices with nice sized portions. This is our tnird visit. So far, so good.

reviews.author: Steven Rudnick
reviews.text: Best Italian food and service I have ever had. We ate there after multnomah falls and it was just so warm and relaxing.

reviews.author: Steven Rudnick
reviews.text: Hands down the most authentic,  best service and most accommodating place I have ever ate. Not to mention 6 served dishes, 1st the drinks, followed by bread with dip (house), appetizer, then salad, main course, tiramisu

reviews.author: David Todd
reviews.text: Open on Christmas Eve  ... Hooray? Great menu of holiday special dishes. Cheery, friendly, good view of city lights across the Columbia from upstairs dining room.

reviews.author: Jessie Medford
reviews.text: If the food is as good as the smell I am going back for myself.

reviews.author: diana walks in water
reviews.text: Excellent service, delicious food. Absolutely the best lasagna I've ever eaten.

reviews.author: Cynthia Kingen
reviews.text: Food is really good and the owner Saul is very nice. We have been coming here for years!

reviews.author: Sean Delgado
reviews.text: Enjoyed the ambience and the quality of food. Food was also served while hot. Very enjoyable lunch!

reviews.author: Jeff Ackerson
reviews.text: Great Italian cuisine at a reasonable price. Make it a stop on your way to the Outlet Mall, The Gorge, or Mt. Hood.

reviews.author: Micah Twiss
reviews.text: Amazing authentic Italian food, and desert! Could’ve been a bad time, but the service wasn’t super great.

reviews.author: Samuel Marlo
reviews.text: Great food for a great price. My wife and I had an appetizer and each had our own entree’s. I had a glass of wine plus they give you bread with oil when you sit down. The food was incredible. The price, 38.00. This is my favorite Italian restaurant hands down. I drive past a lot of them on my way here. But the drive is worth it.

reviews.author: Heather Ayers
reviews.text: Serving sizes are small.  The food is mediocre at best and there is no plate presentation.  Everything looks to be thrown on the plate.

reviews.author: Loretta Rossini
reviews.text: Always good food.   Great Italian dishes.

reviews.author: Bill Emett
reviews.text: I almost deleted the fifth star but because of true professionalism they came though to earn that final star. We recently reserved a large upstairs room a week in advance and there ended up being some confusion about details that were not clearly explained until all 40 of us showed up. But Ristorante Di Pompello bent over backwards to satisfy our group despite minor misunderstandings. We had a wonderful time and the staff performed magnificently. Now what about the food? Absolutely perfect! I enjoyed Salmon cooked to perfection with a soup to die for. I've been there many times before enjoying their various pasta dishes and ravioli. There serve mixed drinks and a wide variety of wines. Trust me on this.... Its worth a drive from across town to the quaint main street of Troutdale. It's just off I 84 and would make a great stopover before or after a day trip up the gorge.

reviews.author: barbara
reviews.text: AMAZING as always. Great good. FANTASTIC service. Family oriented. Best place.

reviews.author: Greg Johnson
reviews.text: Just ok. Staff was great, food was a bit disappointing. I couldn't put my finger on it..but it was lacking.

reviews.author: Jonathan Streech
reviews.text: Delicious food, good prices.

reviews.author: Gary McFarlen
reviews.text: Nice local favorite.  Good prices, generous portions and pleasant flavors.  Not high end, but doesn't pretend to be.

reviews.author: Missy Lively
reviews.text: Very good and affordable!

reviews.author: Kris M
reviews.text: Great food and service

reviews.author: Stephanie Snitily
reviews.text: Very nice lunch spot. Large lunch portions at a nice price. Wonderful service. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Dirty
reviews.text: Horrible food salad portion was a insult, spaghetti was nasty sauce tasted like it came out of a can, both meatballs were frozen in the middle and PINK!!!! I would have given NO STARS if possible. How the hell do you mess up spaghetti at a “Italian” restaurant we will never return or recommend this place!!!

reviews.author: Julie G
reviews.text: Everything is cooked somewhere else and reheated. I didn't recognize a meatball in my mari, which was in a thick gross white sauce. This place needs a rescue, pronto.

reviews.author: Ray Lucero
reviews.text: Italian food the way you like it!  Saul the owner generally there, is sincerely friendly.  I love eggplant parmesagn and Saul's is quite tasty.  Wines are good especially the Chianti. The  environment is perfect for families.  Troutdale and Gresham patrons are loyal to this restaurant.  Enjoy!

reviews.author: Scott Thorsell
reviews.text: My go to place for Italian. Wonderful, authentic food at a reasonable price.

reviews.author: Cindy Treece
reviews.text: A small, somewhat no frills restaurant with excellent customer service and stellar food. The starter is amazing. Fresh rustic bread to dip in oil, balsamic, tomato and basil. Seriously. Amazing.  I had the chicken parmigiana with potato and roasted red pepper soup. Yum. The red sauce was really everything I wanted. Hubs got the lasagna. Not the best we've had but decent. My chicken parmigiana was better. We will return.

reviews.author: Clara Z
reviews.text: Great service. Yummmy food.

reviews.author: Zach Gallimore
reviews.text: Good service. Great 2 person pasta dish deal. Food was good.

reviews.author: Michelle Ghaffari
reviews.text: Very delicious food and great service as well!

reviews.author: Nik Sorochuk
reviews.text: Tasty food, sizeable portions, wallet-friendly.

reviews.author: Ron Carlson
reviews.text: I think everything came out of a can. My dish was supposed to have Tiger Prawns. Must have been a baby tiger. Lol! Won't eat here again! Server was nice at least.

reviews.author: Cassie Wellington
reviews.text: It was a great place for Italian food. The people that were working there were very friendly and the food was amazing and delicious!!! I would definitely be interested in going there again.

reviews.author: Richard Goldie
reviews.text: Very good Italian

reviews.author: Lyle Key
reviews.text: Food was good but not great

reviews.author: Matthew Kintner
reviews.text: Quick service, nice setting. My food was average (chicken entree swimming in wierd sauce with under cooked veggies on the side) but my friends eggplant sandwich was excellent!

reviews.author: Terry Colley
reviews.text: Always delicious food.

reviews.author: nan kar
reviews.text: Great food

reviews.author: Allen Evenson
reviews.text: Very nice place with good prices and a great menu. I will be back.

reviews.author: Lance Loeb
reviews.text: Excellent

reviews.author: Thomas Lane
reviews.text: Great food good price. Lots of character, get seated upstairs if you can!

reviews.author: Ryan Braker
reviews.text: Awesome food. Great prices

reviews.author: Tom Armstrong
reviews.text: Service was excellent, food came quickly and was very good. Prices reasonable.

reviews.author: Debbie Craig
reviews.text: Good food, nice place to eat. They have a few tables outside too.

reviews.author: Denise Burkholder
reviews.text: Andrea was our server and host. She is fantastic, prompt and attentive.

reviews.author: Dan Pohl
reviews.text: Very good food at a decent price

reviews.author: James Quon
reviews.text: We were a party of five for dinner and the locals raved about this place but we found it to be less than good. Not one of the five was happy with their food. We were all very unhappy. The prices were reasonable and the portions were decent so it made for a good value that way but one does not go out for dinner for cheap price and lots of food. Sadly, it wasn't very  good Italian food. Instead, go to the Black Rabbit Which is less than a quarter of a mile away.

reviews.author: E. H.
reviews.text: Great food. Friendly service. You don't walk away hungry here.

reviews.author: Pam Wink
reviews.text: Good food Awesome service The waitress did everything she could to make our crazy dietary restrictions manageable

reviews.author: Dave Hohler
reviews.text: We had a very relaxing and enjoyable dinner here. The food was very tasty and the service was excellent. I  got a dinner salad and although I ordered the large size I was still hungry when I was done. I would certainly recommend this restaurant but next time I will get one of the pasta dishes.

reviews.author: Linda Kay Holevas
reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this place! Saul, the owner, always makes you feel so welcome,  like is genuinely happy to see you. And the food is beyond delicious! Saul is 100% Italian, but he was raised in Mexico City, where his parents had an no Italian restaurant! The menu is large and varied with something for everyone. This restaurant is a must do! I promise you will not regret it! :)
